org.settings4j.util

Class ExpressionLanguageUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.settings4j.util.ExpressionLanguageUtil

  • public final class ExpressionLanguageUtil
extends Object
    A Simple Variable Resolver for ExpressionLanguage. With the JSTLVariableResolver you need a PageContext-Object with HttpRequest etc.... This class is a Simple Variant of the JSTLVariableResolver who accept a Simple Map as PageContext. Example: 1. create a Map with Values(key="name", value="Herr Mustermann") 2. parse the String "Hello, ${name}" with the given Map 3. result: "Hello, Herr Mustermann".
    Author:
    Harald.Brabenetz
    See Also:
    JSTLVariableResolver

      • evaluateExpressionLanguage

        public static Object evaluateExpressionLanguage(String expression,
                                                Map<?,?> context,
                                                Class<?> returnType)
                                         throws org.apache.taglibs.standard.lang.jstl.ELException
        Helper-Function to evaluate a Expression to a given Class.
        Parameters:
        expression - The Expression to be evaluated
        context - The context where the expression has Access
        returnType - the Class-Object who will be returned
        Returns:
        The Result as the given return-Type
        Throws:
        org.apache.taglibs.standard.lang.jstl.ELException - Throw an Exception if the expression is not valid.
